Subjective: The patient has been experiencing dizziness for three days.
The dizziness occurs when getting out of bed.
The dizziness increases with head movements.
The patient has no hearing loss.
The patient has no ringing in the ears (tinnitus).
The patient has not noticed any speech disorders.
The patient has not noticed any loss of strength.
The patient has not noticed any sensory disorders.
The patient has not been ill recently (no recent infection or episode of illness).
Patient experiences nausea during dizzy spells.
Patient experiences palpitations during dizzy spells.
Patient wants clarity about the cause of the dizziness.
Patient wants clarity about the treatment of the dizziness.
Objective: Pulse rate is 62 beats per minute and regular.
No focal deficits were found during neurological examination.
There is no nystagmus during tracking movements.
The Dix-Hallpike test is positive on the left.
The Dix-Hallpike test is positive on the right.
Assessment: Probable diagnosis: benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV).
Plan: Patient has been informed about the nature of BPPV.
Patient has been informed about the expected course of BPPV.
The patient has been reassured that the symptoms are not consistent with a brain tumour.
An Epley manoeuvre has been performed in the practice.
The patient has been given instructions for home exercises for BPPV.
The patient has been referred to Thuisarts.nl for information about BPPV and exercises.
